name: cfhtmlhead
description:
Writes text to the head section of a generated HTML page. It is
 useful for embedding JavaScript code, or putting other HTML
 tags, such as meta, link, title, or base in an HTML page
 header.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to add to the head area of an HTML page. In Lucee a closing tag can be used and then the body between the tags is added to the head

lucee.notes: Lucee supports omitting the parenthesis in script syntax

examples.title: Add RSS feed link to the HTML head section
examples.code: <cfhtmlhead text='<link href="/news.xml" rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="Latest News" />'>

examples.title: Using cfhtmlhead in cfscript
examples.code: cfhtmlhead( text='<link href="/news.xml" rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="Latest News" />');

examples.title: Script syntax alternative
examples.code: htmlhead text='<link href="/news.xml" rel="alternate" type="application/rss+xml" title="Latest News" />';
